document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Zhu, Chao-Dong & Kuhlmann, Michael
document.docTitle: Colletes clypearis Niu, Zhu & Kuhlmann, 2013, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the Colletes clypearis - group (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Colletidae) from China with descriptions of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the Colletes clypearis - group (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Colletidae) from China with descriptions of seven new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to Chinese
Colletes clypearis
-group known species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Males: Antennal flagellum 11 segmented. For the identification of males, it is generally recommended and necessary for most species to dissect genitalia and especially S 7 . Due to variation in size and outer morphology, the shape and size of S 7 is the easiest and most reliable character for the identification of the majority of species. For all species (except
C. hirsutus
sp. n.
,
C. inspersus
sp. n.
,
C. xuezhongi
sp. n.
,
C. yanruae
sp. n.
and
C. xizangensis
sp. n.
, for which males are unknown), S 7 , genitalia and metasoma has been imaged to facilitate identification.

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Gonostylus not triangle-shaped in lateral view (
Figs. 4
d, 7 d, 11 d, 12 d)........................................... 2

-. Gonostylus triangle-shaped in lateral view (
Figs. 1
d, 2 d, 3 d, 5 d, 6 d, 8 b, 8 e, 9 e, 10 d, 13 f, 14 b, 14 e, 21 b, 23 b)............. 5

2 . Gonostylus trapezoid-shaped in lateral view (
Figs. 11
d, 12 d)................................................... 3

-. Gonostylus crescent-shaped or broaden disc-shaped (
Figs. 4
d, 7 d).............................................. 4

3 . Metasomal terga without obvious apical hair bands (
Fig. 11
e); basal part of apical lobe of S 7 short and broad (
Figs. 11
a, 11 b); genitalia in dorsal view as in
Fig. 11
c; head as in
Fig.
11
f.................................
Colletes sanctus Cockerell

-. Metasomal terga with obvious apical hair bands (
Fig. 12
e); basal part of apical lobe of S 7 long and narrow (
Figs. 12
a, 12 b); genitalia in dorsal view as in
Fig. 12
c; head as in
Fig.
12
f.............................
Colletes sidemii Radoszkowski

4 . Gonostylus crescent-shaped in lateral view (
Fig. 4
d); genitalia in dorsal view as in
Fig. 4
c; apex of apical lobe of S 7 no broaden (
Figs. 4
a, 4 b); pilosity on metasomal terga sparse, as in
Fig. 4
e; clypeus broader then long, head as in
Fig.
4
f.......................................................................................
Colletes friesei Cockerell

-. Gonostylus broaden disc-shaped in lateral view (
Fig. 7
d); genitalia in dorsal view as in
Fig. 7
c; apex of apical lobe of S 7 broaden (
Figs. 7
a, 7 b); pilosity on metasomal terga denser, as in
Fig. 7
e; clypeus longer than broad, head as in
Fig.
7
f...................................................................................
Colletes haubrugei Kuhlmann

5 . Gonostylus narrow triangle-shaped in lateral view, dorsolateral margin nearly straight, without notch (
Fig. 3
d); S 7 as in
Figs. 3
a and 3 b.......................................................................
Colletes floralis Eversmann

-. Gonostylus broad triangle-shaped in lateral view, dorsolateral margin always curved, less or more with a notch (
Figs. 1
d, 2 d, 5 d, 6 d, 8 b, 8 e, 9 e, 10 d, 13 f, 14 b, 14 e, 21 b, 23 b); S 7 in different shape............................................ 6

6 . Gonostylus long, distinctly longer than 1 / 2 of gonocoxite (
Fig. 10
d); S 7 as in
Figs. 10
a and 10 b.................................................................................................
Colletes jankowskyi Radoszkowski

-. Gonostylus moderately long or short, no longer than 1 / 2 of gonocoxite (
Figs. 1
d, 2 d, 5 d, 6 d, 8 b, 8 e, 9 e, 13 f, 14 b, 14 e, 21 b, 23 b); S 7 in different shape.............................................................................. 7

-. Apex of apical lobe of S 7 truncated or slightly convex (
Figs. 1
a, 2 a, 5 a, 6 a, 8 a, 8 d, 13 c, 21 d)........................ 11

8 . Apical lobe of S 7 elongated belt-shaped, apex gradually curve to lateral side, subbasal part broaden and acute laterally (
Fig. 23
e)........................................................................
Colletes heilongtanensis
sp. n.
-. Apical lobe of S 7 not belt-shaped, nearly 1 / 2 subbasal part swollen laterally (Figs. 9 a, 14 b, 14 e)...................... 9

9 . Subbasal lateral process of S 7 broaden, nearly twice wide as the greatest width of apical 1 / 2 part of apical lobe of S 7 (Fig. 9 a)............................................................................ Colletes impunctatus Nylander

-. Subbasal lateral process of S 7 only slightly broader than the greatest width of apical 1 / 2 part of apical lobe of S 7 (
Figs. 14
b, 14 e)............................................................................................... 10

10 . Face, vertex and scutum with plenty of black hairs; apical process of gonostylus narrower (
Fig. 14
e)...............................................................................................
Colletes paratibeticus Kuhlmann

-. Face, vertex and scutum without black hairs, pilosity dark paler white; apical process of gonostylus broader (
Fig. 14
b)....................................................................................
Colletes tibeticus Kuhlmann

11 . Apical lobe of S 7 broader, enlarged sheet-shaped (
Figs. 6
a, 21 d)............................................... 12

12 . Gonostylus longer (
Fig. 6
d); subbasal 1 / 2 part strongly swollen laterally (
Fig. 6
a)..............
Colletes harreri Kuhlmann

-. Gonostylus shorter (
Fig. 21
b); only a bit broader medially, subbasal part not swollen laterally (
Fig. 21
d)................................................................................................
Colletes harrerioides
sp. n.

13 . Metasomal terga without obvious apical hair band (
Figs. 2
e, 8 c, 8 f,)........................................... 14

-. Metasomal terga with obvious apical hair band (
Figs. 1
e, 5 e, 13 e).............................................. 16

Fig. 8
d); genitalia as in
Fig. 8
e; punctation and pilosity on T 1 and T 2 as in
Fig.
8
f....................................................................
Colletes himalayensis Kuhlmann

-. Apical lobe of S 7 with subbasal lateral process (
Figs. 2
a, 8 a).................................................. 15

15 . Apical lobe of S 7 longer and slender, subbasal lateral process large (
Fig. 2
a)................
Colletes clypearis Morawitz

-. Apical lobe of S 7 shorter and broader, subbasal lateral process small (
Fig. 8
a); genitalia as in
Fig. 8
b, punctation and pilosity on T 1 and T 2 as in
Fig. 8
c...........................................................
Colletes hedini Kuhlmann

Fig. 13
c); genitalia as in
Fig. 13
f; punctation and pilosity on T 1 and T 2 as in
Fig. 13
d........................................................................
Colletes sodalis ( Cameron )

Figs. 5
a, 5 b); genitalia as in
Figs. 5
c and 5 d; pilosity on face denser (
Fig. 5
f)..................................................................................
Colletes fulvicornis Noskiewicz

-. Apical lobe of S 7 weakly swollen medially (
Figs. 1
a, 1 b); genitalia as in
Figs. 1
c and 1 d; pilosity on face sparser (
Fig. 1
f)...............................................................................
Colletes cinerascens Morawitz
